intro: Impatiens kerinciensis, commonly known as the Kerinci Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Sumatra, Indonesia. It is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant belongs to the Balsaminaceae family and is known for its delicate, spurred petals and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
